docs.title: SATP Kit
docs.text:
Python toolkit for working with SATP Data.

This project is developed in collaboration with the Centre for Advanced Research Computing, University College London.

docs.title: Research Software Engineering Contact
docs.text: Centre for Advanced Research Computing, University College London (arc.collaborations@ucl.ac.uk)

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
We recommend installing in a project specific virtual environment created using a environment management tool such as Conda. To install the latest development version of satp-kit using pip in the currently active environment run

pip install git+https://github.com/soundscape-labs/satp-kit.git

Alternatively create a local clone of the repository with

git clone https://github.com/soundscape-labs/satp-kit.git

and then install in editable mode by running

pip install -e .

docs.title: Running Locally
docs.text: How to run the application on your local system.

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
Tests can be run across all compatible Python versions in isolated environments using tox by running

tox

To run tests manually in a Python environment with pytest installed run

pytest tests

again from the root of the repository.

docs.title: Building Documentation
docs.text:
The MkDocs HTML documentation can be built locally by running

tox -e docs

from the root of the repository. The built documentation will be written to site.

Alternatively to build and preview the documentation locally, in a Python environment with the optional docs dependencies installed, run

mkdocs serve

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text:
• Initial Research
  • Minimum viable product <-- You are Here
  • Alpha Release
  • Feature-Complete Release

docs.title: example_function(argument, keyword_argument='default')
docs.text:
Concatenate string arguments - an example function docstring.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default argument str

An argument.

required keyword_argument str

A keyword argument with a default value.

'default'

Returns:

Type Description str

The concatenation of argument and keyword_argument.

Source code in src/satp_kit/__init__.py 
def example_function(argument: str, keyword_argument: str = "default") -> str:
    """
    Concatenate string arguments - an example function docstring.

    Args:
        argument: An argument.
        keyword_argument: A keyword argument with a default value.

    Returns:
        The concatenation of `argument` and `keyword_argument`.

    """
    return argument + keyword_argument
